title: Software Engineer, Infrastructure
job_description:

As a member of our team, you will have the opportunity to work on complex technical problems, build new features, and improve existing products across various platforms, including mobile devices and web applications. Our teams are constantly pushing the boundaries of user experience, and we're looking for passionate individuals who can help us advance the way people connect globally. Collaborate with cross-functional teams (product, design, operations, infrastructure) to build innovative application experiences
Implement custom user interfaces using latest programming techniques and technologies
Develop reusable software components for interfacing with back-end platforms
Analyze and optimize code for quality, efficiency, and performance
Lead complex technical or product efforts and provide technical guidance to peers

Work on a variety of coding languages and technologies

6+ years relevant experience building large-scale infrastructure applications or similar experience
Experience with scripting languages such as Python, Javascript or Hack

Experience building and shipping high quality work and achieving high reliability
Experience improving quality through thoughtful code reviews, appropriate testing, proper rollout, monitoring, and proactive changes

title: Product Design Engineer
job_description:
At Reality Labs we aim to bring together cross-disciplinary minds in one place to deliver on our mission: build tools that help people feel connected, anytime, anywhere. As a Product Design Engineer, you will take a critical role in developing hardware systems for VR, AR, or New Technology Initiatives. You will become part of a team exploring developing concepts through prototyping and into mass-production consumer electronics. You will work as part of a cross functional team requiring collaboration in domains other than mechanical engineering. Our teams support mechanical engineering fundamentals, prototyping skills, CAD fluency, manufacturing process knowledge, and experience designing consumer electronics.
Product Design Engineer Responsibilities
Lead the mechanical design for a particular component, feature or system while having end-to-end product development understanding
Contribute to mechanical solutions as part of a highly cross-functional team
Model, build, test, and refine prototypes and characterization test systems
Work across the full product development cycle, from concept inception to shipping product
Collaborate and manage work with Asia-based Supply Chain
Push state-of-the-art technologies and approaches to solving complex mechanical problems while working with cross functional technical teams
Travel to external vendors up to 20%
Minimum Qualifications
BS in Mechanical Engineering
8+ years of industry experience in mechanical design
Experience in Design for Manufacturability (DFM), Design for Assembly (DFA), statistical tolerance analysis techniques, functional dimensioning, geometric tolerancing, and 3D/2D CAD
Working knowledge in material properties, such as plastics, metal, adhesive, glass, etc
Testing and analysis experience (FEA, Simulation, Design of Experiments, etc.)
Knowledge of high-volume manufacturing techniques (stamping, machining, injection molding, etc.)
Preferred Qualifications
10+ years of product design and development experience of handheld and/or wearable electronics for high volume manufacturing, including full systems ownership
MS or PhD in Mechanical Engineering
Experience designing handheld and wearable electronics for high volume manufacturing
Experience with NX
Experience with products cosmetic surface treatments and interfacing with industrial design teams
Mandarin and/or Cantonese language skills
Experience designing for human factors

title: Associate General Counsel, Employment Law & Investigations
job_description:
Meta is seeking an attorney to join as Associate General Counsel, Employment Law & Investigations (Global Enterprise Wide Employment Law, GEWEL) in our Employment Law & Investigations Team. This position will report to the Director & Associate General Counsel, Employment Law and will advise on a wide range of employee benefits issues.

You will provide legal advice and counsel, with a focus on issues that arise primarily in the North America region in respect of benefit design and operation. This attorney will provide legal support, help ensure compliance with and provide education on a wide range of NORAM benefit related issues, with particular focus on ERISA, HIPAA and benefit corporate governance, alongside advice on NORAM employment tax, stock and payroll issues.
Associate General Counsel, Employment Law & Investigations Responsibilities
Advise on the design, implementation, and administration of Meta’s NORAM employee benefits plans, including: tax-qualified retirement plans, health plans, and various welfare and fringe benefits plans (e.g., short and long-term disability - including Voluntary Disability Plans - life insurance, survivor benefits, voluntary benefits, wellness, etc.) and Section 125 cafeteria plans
Draft and maintain applicable plan documents, plan amendments, and summary plan descriptions
Negotiate and draft contracts with third-party administrators and benefit service providers
Provide legal advice and counsel relating to compliance with applicable state and federal retirement and health and welfare laws and regulations such as ERISA, state and federal tax, HIPAA, and ACA
Provide legal counsel to fiduciary committees established to administer Meta’s NORAM employee benefits plans
Monitor legislation, regulations, case law, and government enforcement activities related to the above substantive legal areas, and provide proactive strategic advice to the Employment Law Group and relevant stakeholders
Participate in creation and delivery of training related to employment and benefit law matters
Support audits, process reviews, and new policy creation and implementation related to any benefits programs
Facilitate process improvements, create efficiencies, and provide trainings as necessary
Flexibility and willing to work extended hours when necessary to connect with colleagues across regions
Travel throughout the US and possibly internationally as needed
Minimum Qualifications
J.D. degree and membership in at least one state bar
8+ years of ERISA, employee benefits, and health and welfare experience
Preferred Qualifications
Experience with counseling on, or litigation related to, OSHA, FMLA, and/or ADA
Experience advising on all aspects of labor and employment, including for example compensation, payroll, employment tax, incentives and M&A
Prior in-house legal department experience
Experience coordinating and driving to completion large-scale projects

title: Commercial Sourcing Manager, ODM Sourcing
job_description:
The ISCE (Infrastructure Supply Chain and Engineering) organization manages the entire supply chain and engineering efforts related to Meta's infrastructure, including the sourcing and procurement of data center equipment, network hardware, compute racks, and services, as well as inventory management and supply chain risk management. 

The ODM commercial sourcing (CSM) team is part of Meta's Global Technology Sourcing (GTS) team within the Infrastructure Supply Chain Engineering (ISCE) organization. The ODM CSM leads the supplier strategy and commercial relationship for Meta's AI, NW, C&S L10/L11 platform design, development, and manufacturing engagements with Meta's data center infrastructure suppliers. The team is responsible for cost, contract, and overall supplier relationship management. 

The leader in this role will own the commercial relationship and supply agreements for the assigned ODM design partners and manufacturers of compute, storage, and AI platforms. Together with numerous internal partners, you will develop sourcing strategies that address the unique needs of supply chain and manufacturing at hyperscale to ensure the timely delivery of quality infrastructure products globally.
Commercial Sourcing Manager, ODM Sourcing Responsibilities
Strategy: Responsible for the supplier and sourcing strategy for the assigned technology. Collaborate with peers in the development of short and long term strategy to achieve preferential service, pricing, and terms
Business Development: Lead the RFP/RFI/RFQ process, evaluating supplier proposal, supplier selection mechanism, NPI business award process, negotiations, and associated contracts / statement of work
Market Intelligence: Develop and maintain relationships with suppliers’ operational team and executive leadership
Leadership: Drive strategic discussions with Meta's executives and business partners. Be the leader that demonstrates extreme ownership and leverage supply chain expertise to provide solutions
Execution: Be the point of escalation to resolve all commercial, supplier performance, contractual, and relationship issues for the assigned technology. Lead / participate in supplier business reviews and leverage supplier scorecard mechanism
Externally: Influence supplier business models, roadmaps, and support structure to ensure Meta's commercial and technical requirements are met
Minimum Qualifications
BS degree in a related engineering discipline, supply chain, or equivalent experience
12+ years of progressive supply chain experience with 5+ years experience in data center, hyperscalers, cloud service providers, compute, or AI system hardware supply chain
Experience with AI/Compute & Storage L6/L10/L12 manufacturing in ODM/OEM/CM/JDM model
Experience working with contractual agreements such as MSA, MPA, and SOW
Proven track record in managing Asia-based supply chains and building supplier relationships
In depth understanding of ODM cost structures, should cost models, and design for value trade-offs
Experience in supplier evaluation, selection, management, predictive cost modeling, and contract negotiations
Experience with driving decisions guided by analyzing data, cost models, and total cost of ownership
Experience interfacing with internal and external partners in a fast-paced, often ambiguous, entrepreneurial and cross-functional environment, requiring a wide latitude for independent judgment while coordinating people and technical resources
Interpersonal and communication skills, with experience influencing, negotiating, building consensus and making key strategic decisions
Preferred Qualifications
MS degree in a related engineering discipline, supply chain, or equivalent experience
15+ years of business or supply chain experience in the data center, cloud service providers, Compute, or AI system server and hardware supply chain and associated industries
5+ years of experience with directly managing commercial relationship for AI, Compute and Storage L10 server manufacturing in ODM/OEM/CM/JDM model
Direct experience partnering with C-suite executives of suppliers/partner in the AI/C&S L10 server manufacturing
Knowledge on the ODM/CM/OEM landscape, market, players, business models

title: Optical Additive Manufacturing Materials Process Engineer
job_description:
We are seeking an experienced product and manufacturing engineer with experience in lens industrial manufacturing processes (e.g., anti-reflective coating, lamination, wet coating processes etc.) to drive product validation, development from concept to mass production in Asia together with manufacturing vendors and suppliers. The candidate will have demonstrated knowledge of materials, manufacturing processes, process risks, and quality control, along with a proven track record in launching industrial products through collaboration with Chinese vendors and contract manufacturers (CMs).

You will serve as the technical bridge between global R&D and local manufacturing, ensuring process robustness, quality, and scalability throughout the end-to-end process flow.
Optical Additive Manufacturing Materials Process Engineer Responsibilities
Lead product development/scaling up in China, ensuring seamless integration of materials, processes, and quality control while working closely with local vendors, contract manufacturers, and global teams
Drive process optimization for lens manufacturing (e.g., anti-reflective coating, lamination, wet processes) to improve yield, efficiency, and quality at supplier/CM sites
Conduct on-site technical reviews with vendors to troubleshoot process issues, qualify materials, and validate production readiness
Identify and mitigate process risks in manufacturing, ensuring robust and scalable production through PFMEA and other methodologies
Collaborate with global R&D, engineering, production teams, and Chinese suppliers to understand product requirements and translate them into manufacturable solutions
Develop and execute proof-of-concept (POC) projects, exploring materials and processes to enhance product performance
Work closely with suppliers and equipment vendors to evaluate new technologies for lens manufacturing
Lead design for manufacturability (DFM) reviews to ensure smooth transition from prototype to mass production
Establish quality control standards and process validation protocols to meet industry and customer specifications together with vendors
Support new product introductions (NPI), troubleshooting process issues during ramp-up and ensuring on-time delivery
Travel extensively (more than 60% within China) to CM/supplier sites for process validation, troubleshooting, and production support
Stay updated on emerging trends in lens materials, coatings, and advanced manufacturing technologies
Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor in Materials Science and Engineering, Chemistry or related field
5+ years in lens, optical products or consumer electronics manufacturing with expertise in coatings, lamination, wet processes, and curing technologies
